metadata.title: Learning Modern Literature: Literary Education in Western Europe (1880 – 1940)
metadata.author: N/A

Plan Overview
Plan Overview
A Data Management Plan created using DMPonline.be
Title: 
Title: 
Learning Modern Literature: Literary Education in Western Europe (1880 – 1940)
Creator:
Creator:
Pieter Verstraeten
Principal Investigator: 
Principal Investigator: 
Pieter Verstraeten
Affiliation: 
Affiliation: 
KU Leuven (KUL)
Template: 
Template: 
KU Leuven BOF-IOF
Principal Investigator:
Principal Investigator:
 
Pieter Verstraeten
Project abstract:
Project abstract:
Towards the end of the 19th century, school developed into a powerful institution that became accessible to increasingly larger social groups. Literature in the
diverse vernacular languages functioned as a core component of the modernizing school curricula. The research project Learning Modern Literature. Literary
Education in Western Europe (1880-1940) researches the complex interactions between the world of school and the world of literature in Western Europe in the
period of modernism. How did the field of 'literary education' develop in different European nations and in different educational contexts? Why was learning to read
literature considered an important part of education? What functions and roles were assigned to literature and literary texts, inside and outside the language class?
How were texts interpreted and adapted to function in diverse pedagogical contexts? How did literature itself reflect upon and evaluate learning literature at school?
ID: 
ID: 
214053

Documentation and Metadata
Documentation and Metadata
Data will be made retrievable and understandable by the following procedures:
1
. 
Similar data types, file types, file structures and file names for each WP (subproject) as specified in table A below.
2
. 
Detailed bibliographies for each WP and a general bibliography, with reference to source materials as specified in table A below.
3
. 
Information on how corpuses are constructed will be specified in the publications as specified in table B below.
4
. 
Methodologies specifying how source materials are processed and interpreted will be specified in the publications as specified in table B below.

Literature in the diverse vernacular languages functioned as a core component of the modernizing school curricula. The research project Learning Modern Literature. Literary Education in Western Europe (1880-1940) researches the complex interactions between the world of school and the world of literature in Western Europe in the period of modernism. How did the field of 'literary education' develop in different European nations and in different educational contexts? Why was learning to read literature considered an important part of education? What functions and roles were assigned to literature and literary texts, inside and outside the language class? How were texts interpreted and adapted to function in diverse pedagogical contexts? How did literature itself reflect upon and evaluate learning literature at school?
